attachments.fallback: [September 29th, 2016 11:16 PM] ccooper21: <@U2G4G5LTY> Someone can correct me if I'm wrong, but based on the chaincode examples I'm under the impression that if you want to maintain temporal state that you need to pull it along as you update the world state.  In other words, before storing any new state, you'd need to load the previous state and merge it into the new state (e.g. some kind of compound JSON object) and then store the merged result into the world state.
attachments.text: <@U2G4G5LTY> Someone can correct me if I'm wrong, but based on the chaincode examples I'm under the impression that if you want to maintain temporal state that you need to pull it along as you update the world state.  In other words, before storing any new state, you'd need to load the previous state and merge it into the new state (e.g. some kind of compound JSON object) and then store the merged result into the world state.
